name: Vladimir Sergeyevich Bazan

biography.content: Born in t. Unecha, Bryansk region, USSR.
Graduated from Fine arts and grafics facultyof  Vitebsk Pedagogical Institute.
Worked as photographer, reporter, secretary in Vitebsk newspaper «Stroitel».
Main redactor, designer and photoreporter in newspaper «Vitebski kurier».

works: «Paris! Paris! I don’t want to return home!» (2001—2007)

biography.content: Was born in the town of Ivye, Lida. In Ivie graduated from “home school”, from childhood was fascinated with photography. Over time, the hobby grew into a professional occupation.
Founded the first photo studio in Vileika. Until 1925, he was the only professional photographer in the district. He was also actively engaged in social life.
Organized a drama club in Svir, Vileyka, where he staged performances in favor of poor children.
Photographed the arrival of the President of the II Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth Ignacy Mostitsky during his visit to Vileyka County.
Was arrested by the NKVD and detained in the Vileyka prison..
Condemned as a “socially dangerous element” and sent to a forced labor camp “Temlag”. Further fate is unknown.
Rehabilitated.

name: Jan Bulhak

biography.content: Born in D. Ostashino near Novogrudok.
Studied philosophy at Jagiellonian University in Krakow (not graduated). Returning from Krakow, he lived in the estate Pereseka near Minsk, where he sent correspondence to the Vilna Newspapers.
Opened a photo Studio in Vilna on Portovaya street 12 (burned down in 1944; about 30 thousand negatives spoiled, some survived).
Photographed the architectural monuments of the city.
Taught art photography at the Department of fine arts of Stefan Batory University. He became one of the founders and Chairman of the Vilna photo club.
Was one of the editors of magazines „Przegld Fotograficzny“, „Fotograf Polski“.

Moved to Warsaw. He made about a thousand photos of the destroyed and recovering Warsaw, about 2 thousand photos of the Western lands attached to Poland. In 1947 he became the founder of the Union of photographers of Poland and led it until his death.
Buried in Warsaw.

name: Georgy Leonardovich Likhtarovich

biography.content: Born in Minsk, BSSR.
Worked as an assistant cameraman at the Minsk Studio of popular science and documentary films.
Served in the army in v. Pechi. Published in periodicals.

Worked as a photographer at the Institute of art, Ethnography and folklore of the Academy of Sciences. He illustrated the first volumes of the “Collection of historical and cultural monuments of Belarus”.
Studied at the faculty of architecture of BPI. Since 1972 he taught photography at the theatre and art Institute.
Worked as a photojournalist in state publishing houses. Numerous photo albums, monographs of Belarusian artists, encyclopedias, posters, sets of postcards, booklets.
As a photo artist he published a photo album “Hello, Belarus” – “The Best Book of the Year” at the Belarusian competition “Art of the Book”.
Elected to the Rada of the Belarusian intelligentsia.
Member of the Rada of the Belarusian public Association “Photoart”.

works: «Decorative and fine art of Belarus of XII-XVIII centuries»

name: Mikhail Markovich Shmerling

biography.content: Born in Vitebsk.
Graduated from Minsk College of Polygraphy.

Worked at the Vitebsk regional local lore Museum. He received the first prize at the all-Union exhibition «Photography-71» medal at the international exhibition «Man and Earth”. He was awarded honorary diplomas of photo salons in Romania, England.
Worked in the production Association “Art”.
Worked in the editorial office of the regional newspaper “Narodnoe Slovo”.

works: “People's artist of the USSR S. Stanyuta” (1990)
